column1: Janet's ducks lay 16 eggs a day. Every morning, she eats three for breakfast and uses the other four to make muffins for her friends. What's left over, she sells daily at the farmers market, at $2 a fresh duck egg. How much (in dollars) does she make each day at the farmers market?
A dress requires two rolls of blue fiber and half that amount of white fiber.
Josh goes into a home renovation business, buys a house for $80,000, invests $50,000 in the renovation, and the house goes up in value by 150 percent.
Jacques runs three sprints three times a week. He runs 60 meters in each sprint. In total, how many meters does he run per week?

To keep her chickens healthy, Wendi gives them three bowls of mixed food containing seeds, mealworms and vegetables every day. She feeds them in three separate meals. In the morning, she gives them 15 bowls of food. In the afternoon, she gives them another 25. If her farm has 20 chickens, how many bowls of food should she give them for the last meal of the day?

Kylar goes to the store to buy glasses for his new apartment. A glass costs $5, but each second glass costs only 60 percent of the price. Kylar wants to buy 16 glasses. How much will he have to pay to buy them?
Toulouse has twice as many sheep as Charleston, Charleston has four times as many as Seattle, if Seattle has 20 sheep, how many sheep do Toulouse, Charleston and Seattle have in total?

Carla is downloading a 200GB file. She's downloading at 2GB per minute but at 40% download, Windows requires a restart to install the updates, which takes 20 minutes. Carla then has to start the download again from the beginning. How long does it take to download the file?

John drives for 3 hours at a speed of 60 mph, then turns back after realizing that he forgot something very important at home. He tries to get home in 4 hours, but loses the first 2 hours in traffic jams. For the next half hour, he drives at 30 mph, before driving at 80 mph for the remaining time on the 4 hours. What is the distance between him and his home at the end of the 4 hours?

For the first 40 hours of work a week, Elisa's hourly rate is $10 and for her overtime hours, she also receives 1.2 times her normal hourly rate. If Elisa worked 45 hours this week, what will her weekly wage be?

A new program was downloaded 60 times in the first month. The number of downloads in the second month was three times that of the first month. It then decreased by 30 percent in the third month. How many times in total was the program downloaded in those three months?

Toula bought several different pastries at the bakery. She bought three dozen doughnuts at $68 a dozen, two dozen cupcakes at $80 a dozen, and six dozen cheesecake cupcakes at $55 a dozen. What is the total cost?

Carlos wants to plant a lemon tree. The cost of planting is 90 dollars. Each year, the tree will produce seven lemons that will be sold for $1.5 each. Watering and feeding the tree costs $3 per year. How many years will it take Carlos to start making money with his lemon tree?

Melanie sells from door to door. When she moved to the green house, she sold a third of her vacuum cleaners, then two more to the red house, and finally half of what was left in the orange house. If Melanie has five vacuum cleaners left, how many vacuum cleaners did she have at the beginning?

In a dance class of 20 students, 20 percent of them are enrolled in contemporary dance, 25 percent in jazz dance, and the rest in hip-hop dance. What is the percentage of students enrolled in hip-hop dance?

A trader hesitates between two buying plans: jewelry worth $5,000 or electronics worth $8,000. His financial advisor speculates on a 2.5% increase in the jewelry market and a 1.2% increase in the electronics market during the same month. If the trader makes a choice that maximizes his profit at the end of the month, what would that profit be?

Two trains leave San Rafael at the same time. They first head west and both travel 80 miles. The next day they travel north, covering 150 miles. What is the distance each train traveled in those two days?
Jill makes $20 an hour as a teacher and $30 an hour as a cheerleading coach, so if she works 35 hours a week as a teacher, 15 hours a week as a coach, and 50 weeks a year, what is her annual salary?
For her breakfast, Claire makes an omelet of three eggs every morning. How many dozen eggs will she eat in four weeks?

Marissa is hiking a 12-mile trail. She took an hour to walk the first four miles, then another hour to walk the next two miles. If she wants her average speed to be 4 miles per hour, what speed (in miles per hour) does she need to reach to walk the remaining distance?

I have 10 liters of orange juice made up of two thirds water. I want to mix it with 15 liters of pineapple juice made up of three quarters water, I turn over a liter of orange juice. How much water is in the remaining 24 liters?
Raymond and Samantha are cousins. Raymond was born six years before Samantha and had a son at the age of 23. If Samantha is now 31, how old is Raymond's son?

Billy sells DVDs. This Tuesday, he has 8 customers. His first 3 customers each buy one DVD. The next 2 customers each buy two. The last 3 customers don't buy any. How many DVDs did Billy sell on Tuesday?
A candle that's lit is melting and losing two centimeters every hour. How many centimeters will the candle have lost after burning from 1 to 5 p.m.?
Kyle bought last year's bestseller for $19.50, with a 25% discount on the original price.

Mary ordered a chicken dish that costs $12, five cartons of milk for $3 each, four apples for $1.50 each, and a few boxes of pizza. Mary paid a total of $50 for each box of pizza. If each box of pizza costs $8.50, how many boxes did Mary order?
Mishka bought 3 shorts, 3 pants and 3 pairs of shoes. A short costs $16.50, a pants $22.50 and a pair of shoes $42. How much money did Mishka spend in total on the purchase of these clothes?
Cynthia eats one serving of ice cream every night. She buys boxes of 15 servings of ice cream each, at $4.00 a box. After 60 days, how much will she spend on ice cream?
Henry made two stops during his 60-mile bike trip. He marked his first stop after 20 miles. He stopped again 15 miles before the end of the trip. How many miles did he travel between the two stops?

While shopping for shoes, Gloria comes across a pair of boots that fit her budget. However, she must choose between the boots and two pairs of high heels that cost two and a half dollars less than the boots. If one of the high heels costs $33 and the other costs twice as much, what is the dollar price of the boots?
If the sum of their ages is 162 years, how old will Allen be in 10 years?

Gunter is trying to count the candy in a jar. He asks his friends to estimate the amount. One of them says 80, another says 20 more than half of the first one. A third says 25 percent more than the first one. What is the average of their estimates?
Jean takes care of 10 dogs. Each dog needs half an hour a day to walk and do other things. How many hours does Jean spend a week taking care of dogs?
Gretchen has 110 coins. The gold coins are 30 coins more than the silver ones. How many gold coins does Gretchen have?
If Raymond has 40 pieces of jewelry, how many pieces of jewelry does Siobhan have?
Mike plays ping-pong for 40 minutes. In the first 20 minutes, he scores four points. He scores 25 percent more points in the next 20 minutes. How many points did he score in total?
Terry eats two yogurts a day, and they sell them for the price of four yogurts for five dollars.

John wants to sell all his toys and use the money to buy video games. He owns 13 Lego sets and sells them for $15 each. Eventually, he buys himself eight video games at $20 each, which leaves him with $5. How many Lego sets does he have left?
John runs 60 miles every week. He runs three days a week. On the first day he runs for three hours and runs twice as much the other two days. What is his running speed?

Dana runs four times faster than she walks, but jumps twice as fast as she runs. If she jumps at three miles per hour, how many miles does she cover in six hours, knowing that she spends one-third of that time running and two-thirds walking?
Brandon's iPhone is four times older than Ben's. Ben's iPhone is twice as old as Suzie's. If Suzie's iPhone is one year old, how old is Brandon's?

Perg, the great dragon, sat atop Mount Farbo and spewed fire from a distance of 1,000 feet. Polly could throw the golden spear, the only weapon capable of piercing the dragon, but to a distance of 400 feet, well within range of its flames. However, when Polly held the sapphire stone, she could throw it three times farther. By holding the gemstone, how far could Polly keep herself out of the reach of the flames, while still managing to strike the dragon with the golden spear?

Grandma Jones prepared five apple pies for the firefighters' lunch. She then cut each pie into eight pieces and arranged the five pies on the buffet table for everyone to serve themselves. At the end of the evening, after all the guests had taken and eaten their pies, there were 14 pieces left. How many pieces did the guests take?

According to its nutritional information, a bag of chips contains 250 calories per serving. If a 300-gram bag contains five servings, how many grams of chips would you eat, knowing that your daily calorie target is 2,000 and that you've already consumed 1,800 calories?

Charlie wants to sell beeswax candles. Each pound of beeswax allows him to produce 10 pointed candles. A pound of beeswax and fuses is delivered for $10. If he produces and sells 20 candles, what is his net profit, knowing that each candle is sold for $2.00?

Meredith is a freelance blogger whose job is to write articles on health topics and submit them to clients every day. A blog post takes an average of 4 hours of work, which includes research and writing. Last week, she wrote 5 articles on Monday and 2/5 times as many articles on Tuesday. On Wednesday, she wrote twice as many articles as she wrote on Tuesday. Calculate the total number of hours spent writing articles during those three days.

Before going to work at the coffee shop, Candice put 80 pens in her purse. On the way, she stopped to buy a pack of pens at the store. When she got to work, she put one pens on each of the 220 coffee cups. If she ended up with only 23 pens left, how many pens were in the pack she bought?
John buys twice as many red ties as blue ties. Red ties cost 50% more. He spent $200 on blue ties that cost $40 each. How much did he spend on ties?
To support the tomato plants in her garden, Tracy used a 4-foot-long iron wire. This wire was cut into several 6-inch-long pieces. How many pieces did she get?

Richard lives in one of the apartments in a 15-story building. Each floor contains 8 apartments. Given that three-quarters of the building is occupied, what is the total number of unoccupied apartments in the building?
Lloyd owns a chicken coop. His hens produce 252 eggs a day and they sell them for $2 a dozen. How much does Lloyd make a week from his eggs?
Tom's boat is moving at 10 miles per hour. He sails from 1 to 4 p.m., then makes the return trip at the speed of 6 miles per hour. How long will it take him to get back?

Uriah's bag becomes too heavy for him. He has to reduce it by 15 pounds. Each of his comic strips weighs a quarter of a pound and each of his toys weighs a half pound. If he removes 30 comic strips, how many toys will he have to remove?

A mechanic makes different rates for truck and car tires. For each truck tire repaired, he charges $60, and he charges $40 for each car tire. On Thursday, he repairs six truck tires and four car tires. On Friday, he repairs 12 car tires and doesn't repair any truck tires. On the day when the earnings were highest, how much money did the mechanic make in addition?

The Doubtfire sisters leave the local animal shelter with seven adopted kittens in their car. On the way back, they receive a call from their mother informing them that their two domestic cats have just had kittens. She says that Patchy, the first cat, has had three times the number of adopted kittens, while Trixie, the other, has had 12. How many kittens does the Doubtfire family have now?
John has 30 lollipops. He eats two. With the remaining lollipops he wants to make bags of two lollipops each. How many bags will John get?
Peter plans to go to the movies this week. He always buys a $7 ticket and $7 popcorn. If he has $42 for the week, how many times can he go to the movies?

A delivery truck is about to cross a wooden bridge that can't carry a load of more than 5,000 pounds. The truck is filled with identical boxes, weighing 15 pounds each. The combined weight of the driver and the empty truck is 3,755 pounds. How many boxes can be loaded onto the truck without exceeding the weight limit of the bridge?

Stephen ordered groceries online. His final bill was $40.00 and because it was a delivery service provider, they raised the bill by 25 percent and added $3.00 in delivery fees. Stephen also gave a $4.00 tip. Counting the additional fees, what was the final price of Stephen's order?
A raspberry tree has six bunches of 20 fruits each, as well as 67 individual fruits scattered throughout the tree.
A basket contains 25 oranges, of which one is bad, 20 percent are not ripe, two are sour and the rest are good. How many oranges are good?

Janet buys a pin for her daughter. She spends $500 to get the manufacturing equipment, then an additional $800 to get it made by a jeweler. Then she spends 10% of that money to get it insured. How much did she spend in total?

If Marcy works for the same company for 40 years, she receives a pension of $50,000 a year. After 20 years of work, she is entitled to 5% of that amount per year. Assuming she resigns after 30 years of service, what will her annual pension be?

Aleena subscribed to a streaming service that charges her $140 a month. If the streaming company charged that amount in the first half of the year, then 10% less in the second half of the year, calculate the total amount she paid for the streaming service at the end of the year.

Sophie is considering a car trip and wonders how far she can travel with one full tank of gas. She has done 100 miles since the last fill and had to add 4 gallons of gas to fill the tank again. The user manual says her tank has a capacity of 12 gallons of gas. How many miles can Sophie travel with one full tank of gas?

Jim spends two hours watching TV, then decides to go to bed and read for half the time he spends watching TV. He repeats this three times a week. How many hours does he spend watching TV and reading in four weeks?

A basketball tournament hosts four schools competing. Each school sent a women's team and a men's team, each with five players. The schools also sent each a coach. How many people did the schools send in total?

A treasure hunter dug up a chest full of precious stones. This chest contained 175 diamonds, 35 rubies less than the amount of diamonds, and twice as many emeralds than rubies. How many precious stones were in the chest?
There are twice as many boys as girls at Dr. Wertz's school. If there are 60 girls and 5 students per teacher, how many teachers are there?

Bailey has a certain amount of money to start with, and then she gets a $5 weekly allowance for eight weeks, and if she ends up with a total of $100 at the end of eight weeks, how much money did Bailey start with?
During the week, Judy gives five dance classes every day and eight classes on Saturdays. If each class has 15 students and she charges $15.00 per student, how much money does she make in a week?

Kélian prepares dishes based on two recipes, one with 20 instructions and the other with twice as many instructions as the first. How many instructions does Kélian have to read to prepare both dishes?
Tommy raises money for his charity by selling brownies at $3 a slice and cheesecake at $4 a slice. If Tommy sells 43 brownies and 23 slices of cheesecake, how much money did Tommy raise?
Shiela bought five cell phones at a price of $150 each, payable in 3 installments. An interest of 2% will be charged for each unit. How much will Shiela have to pay each month for 3 months?

Artie sells flowers at the farmers' market. He sells three types: soucis, petunias, and begonias. He usually sells soucis for $2.74 a pot, petunias for $1.87 a pot, and begonias for $2.12 a pot. Since he has no currency today, Artie decides to round all his prices to the nearest dollar. If he sells 12 pots of soucis, 9 pots of petunias, and 17 pots of begonias, how much money will he make?

Luke spends time building sand castles on the beach. He notices that each floor of a sand castle has half the floor area of the lower floor. What is the average floor area, knowing that the sand castle has 4 and the highest floor has an area of 16 square feet?

Cecilia just bought a new puppy. According to the vet, she'll have to give him one bowl of dog food every day for the first 180 days. Then she'll have to give him two bowls every day for the rest of his life. If one bag of food is 110 bowls, how many bags of dog food will Cecilia use in the first year?
So, given that Sarah does 400 pounds of laundry, calculate the difference between the amount of laundry Raymond and David do.
So, if Vincent has a choice between buying flowers in a three-pack for $2.50 or a two-pack for $1. How much money will he save if he buys 18 flowers at the best price?
John adopts a dog and takes it to the groomer for $100, and the groomer offers him a 30% discount, since he's a new customer.
Two girls each received 1/6 of the 24 liters of water. A boy then received 6 liters of water. How many liters of water are left?

Charlie had 10 stickers. He bought 21 more in a department store at the mall and got 23 for his birthday. Then he gave 9 to his sister and used 28 to decorate a greeting card. How many stickers does he have left?
Grace weighs 125 pounds. Alex weighs two less than four times Grace's weight. What is the sum of their two weights in pounds?
Dan plants three rose bushes. Each rose bush has 25 roses and each rose has eight thorns. How many thorns are there in all?
A football team has played 22 games, they've won more times than they've lost.

Gene makes a t-shirt out of old t-shirts. He has a t-shirt for every vacation trip he's ever taken. Each t-shirt is one of the squares in the t-shirt. Each row of squares corresponds to a different vacation year. Since he's 23, he's been going on vacation four times a year. He's 34 now. How many squares does his t-shirt total?

Greg has an alarm set to go off three times a day. When the alarm goes off, it goes off until Greg turns it off. The first time it went off today, it went off four times. The second time, it went off three times longer than the first time. The third time, it went off twice as long as the second time. How many times did the alarm go off in total?

A company pays $600 per month to each employee. It has a policy to add 10 percent to the starting salary of each of its employees with five years of service. If Sylvie just completed five years with the company last December, what will her annual salary be after three additional years of service?
Marilyn's first record sold 10 times as many copies as Harald's, so if they sold 88,000 copies together, how many copies did Harald sell?

Christina throws a birthday party and asks for 0.75 gift bags per guest, since 1/4 of the guests don't show up, knowing that she invited 16 friends and that the gift bags cost $2 each, how much will she spend?

Ted the tyrannosaur plans to bring potato salad to the dinosaur picnic. He knows it will cost 10 pounds for an adult dinosaur and half that for a child. If there are 20 adults and 5 children at the picnic, how many pounds of potato salad does Ted have to bring to feed everyone?
Jan has three times as many pets as Marcia. Marcia has two more than Cindy. If Cindy has four pets, how many pets in total do they all have?

Emily has four children named Amy, Jackson, Corey, and Jacques. Amy is five years older than Jackson and two years younger than Corey. If Jacques is ten years and one year younger than Corey, how old is Jackson?

Lee used to run the 400 meter hurdles two seconds faster than Gerald. But after changing his diet, Gerald improved his speed by 10 percent. If Lee runs the 400 meter hurdles in 38 seconds, what is Gerald's running time in seconds after his new diet?

In a certain neighborhood, the pet rabbit population is twelve units less than the total number of pet dogs and cats. If for every dog there are two cats and there are 60 dogs in total, how many pets are there in the neighborhood?
Of the 200 students in the sixth grade, two-fifths are boys and two-thirds of the girls are members of the Boy Scouts.
Harry slept nine hours last night. His friend Jacques slept only two-thirds of that time. Compared to Jacques, how many more hours did Harry sleep?

When Freda cooks canned tomatoes to make sauce, they lose half their volume. She uses 16-ounce cans that each contain three tomatoes. Freda's last tomato sauce preparation yielded 32 ounces of sauce. How many tomatoes did Freda use?

Cars are stuck in a queue on the highway. Some cars manage to get through in the first 15 minutes of the traffic jam, then 20 other cars in the last 15. 5 cars get out of the queue so they don't have to cross the traffic jam. Given that there were initially 30 cars on the highway, how many cars crossed the traffic jam in the first 15 minutes?

Mary loves gardening. Yesterday she received 18 new potted plants from her favorite nursery. She already had two on each of the 40 windowsills of her large country house. So she decided that tomorrow she would take one potted plant from each window sill and give it generously to friends and relatives. How many potted plants would Mary have left?

One day, four friends visited Jerome. The first one rang the bell 20 times before Jerome opened, the second one 1/4 times longer than the first, and the third 10 times longer than the fourth. Given that the fourth friend rang the bell 60 times, how many times did the bell ring in total?

Solo has to read four pages of his science textbook, 20 pages of the social studies textbook, seven pages of the history textbook, and eight pages of the geography textbook. This Monday, he read 15 pages. If he has only four days left to finish reading, how many pages will it take him to read on average every day?

John likes to drink a glass of water at breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Finally, he also drinks one before going to bed. He follows this routine every day of the week. On weekends, however, he likes to relax and drink a soda at dinner. How many glasses of water does John drink in a week?

A bank of fog comes from the ocean and gradually covers a city. It takes 10 minutes to cover 3 miles of the city. If the city extends 42 miles from the edge of the ocean to the opposite edge inland, how many minutes will it take for the bank of fog to cover the entire city?

Poppy is trying to solve a puzzle of 1,000 pieces. She puts a quarter of the pieces on the board, then her mother puts a third of the remaining pieces. How many pieces of the puzzle are left to place?
Cody eats three times as many cookies as Amir. If Amir eats five cookies, how many cookies do they both eat in total?
John has three boxes, each box is five by six by four inches, the walls are one inch thick, what is the total volume of the three boxes?

Every night, Frankie watches TV after doing his homework. Last Monday and Tuesday, he watched an hour of his favorite show every night. Wednesday, he watched a few episodes of a 30-minute show. Thursday, he finished his homework early and watched an hour and a 30-minute show. Friday, he was able to stay up late because of the weekend, and so watched two hour-long episodes each. If he watched a total of seven hours of television, how many 30-minute episodes did he watch on Wednesday?

Henri is making cookies for a local baking contest. He wants to make twice as many as last year. At the end of the batch, he finds that he has made 15 more cookies than he planned. He drops five of his cookies while he cools them and ends up with a total of 110 cookies. How many cookies did Henri make last year?

A gas station sells gas at $3.00 a gallon, an app company offers a $0.20 refund per gallon if you fill up at that station, if someone buys 10 gallons of gas, what will be the purchase price, after the refunds?

Marcell and Beatrice compete to see which of the two eats the most fruit rolls, so they roll as many as they can find. Unfortunately, due to a mistake, Beatrice ends up with two wide rolls and 24 long rolls, while Marcell gets three wide rolls and 14 long rolls. If each of the two eats all of his rolls, how many have they eaten on average?

A leak occurred in Julia's boat while she was on the lake. The boat started taking two liters of water every ten feet rowed towards the shore. It took her sixteen seconds to go twenty feet. The shore being 64 seconds, how much water had the boat taken when Julia reached the shore?

A classroom has a whiteboard shared by four teachers who take turns using the room, and each of them teaches two classes a day and uses the whiteboard every time. If the whiteboard is cleaned three times per lesson, how many times is it cleaned in a day?
Every day, Ryan plants two flowers in his garden, and if five of them haven't bloomed, how many flowers will he have in two weeks?

Jamal's phone can store six times as many photos as Brittany's phone, and Brittany's phone can store up to 50 times as many birds as there are birds in the photo that Jamal took, where we see ducks in the zoo. If Jamal's phone has a capacity of 1,800 photos, how many ducks can we see in the photo that he took?

Sasha, after buying some timber, notices that the price has gone up by 50 percent in the last few months, so she decides to sell the remaining timber. She has ten 2x4x10 boards left, which cost her $10 each. She also has five 4x4x10 boards, which she bought for $16 each. If she can sell them all, what will be her profit?

Katy makes coffee using teaspoons of sugar and cups of water in a ratio of 7:13. Calculate the number of teaspoons she poured, knowing that she used a total of 120 teaspoons of sugar and cups of water.
For each of his three children, John buys two pairs of shoes that cost $60 each. How much did he pay?

A customs officer at the main customs clearance port of SeaSide counted 2 containers of imported vehicles, each with 5 vehicles inside. The next day, new containers arrived and brought the total number of vehicles present in the port to 30. Calculate the number of containers imported on the second day, assuming that all containers contain 5 vehicles.

Adrian's total salary was 30% higher than Lylah's. Four years later, that salary had increased and was 40% higher than what he was earning at the start. If Adrian and Lylah's salaries increased simultaneously, and Adrian was earning $40,000 four years ago, calculate the total amount of their two salaries four years later.
Miguel uses two boxes of paper a week for his drawing. If each box contains 30 sheets of paper, how many sheets of paper does he use per month?

Morisette and Kael were asked to bring fruit. Morisette brought 5 apples and 8 oranges, while Kael brought twice as many apples and half as many oranges as Morisette. How many fruits did they bring in total?

Sadie slept 8 hours on Monday. She slept 2 hours less each of the two days that followed, because of certain obligations. Knowing that the rest of the week she slept 1 hour more than on those two days, how many hours did she sleep in total during the whole week?
Rosie runs at 10 miles per hour for three hours, then she runs 5 miles per hour, how many miles will she have traveled in seven hours?

Jennie brings a helper to her mother's office. She has a stack of 60 letters to stamp and another with letters already stamped. She stamps a third of the letters to stamp. If there are now 30 letters in the stack of stamped letters, how many were there in that stack when Jennie started the work?

Julia was preparing for a dinner party at her house, during which she was going to serve stew. She noticed that she had no more plastic spoons, so she bought a new pack of spoons. Later, her husband also bought a pack of five new spoons and gave them to Julia. During cooking, Julia used three spoons to taste her stew. Later, when she went to set the table, she had a total of 12 spoons. How many spoons were in the pack Julia bought?
Dylan needed chicken sausage and fish sausage to make sausage rolls at a party. He bought 38 chicken sausage and 6 fish sausage more than there were chicken. How many sausages did Dylan buy in total?
After being transferred to a new school, Amy made 20 more friends than Lily. If Lily made 50 friends, how many friends do Lily and Amy have in total?

Well's mother sells watermelons, peppers and oranges at the local store. A watermelon costs three times as much as a pepper and an orange is five times cheaper than a watermelon. Dillon is sent to the store to buy four watermelons, 20 peppers and 10 oranges. What is the total amount he will spend if each pepper costs $15?

A hospital admits 500 people a day. Each patient is examined for an average of 24 minutes. Doctors charge the hospital $150 per hour and the hospital charges the patients $200 per hour. How much profit does the hospital make from these consultations?

Nissa hires 60 seasonal elves to play Santa's village in her department store. One-third of the elves quit after kids threw up on them, then 10 of the remaining elves quit after kids kicked them in the shin. How many elves are left?
In May, Joseph's expenses were $500, down from $60 in June.

Pam and Fred went to a carnival. Pam rode the roller coaster twice and Fred rode it four times. Then each of them rode the sled twice. If each ride costs six tickets, how many tickets did they use that day?
On Monday, Walt walked four miles. On Tuesday, he walked six times as many miles as on Monday. His Monday-Wednesday mileage was 41 miles. How many miles did he walk on Wednesday?
Tom does four car washes a month. If each car wash costs $15, how much does he spend in a year?

Brian's friend Bobby has five video games less than three times the amount of video games Brian has. If Brian has 20 video games but lost five just before the comparison started, how many video games does Bobby have?
There are only 27 unicorns left in the world. One third of them are in the Highlands of Scotland. Two thirds of the Scottish unicorns are female. How many Scottish unicorns are there?
Rory orders two submarines for $7.50 each, two packages of fries for $1.50 each, and two cookies for $1.00 each, and a 20% delivery fee is charged at the checkout counter, and Rory adds a $5.00 tip.

Yesterday, Marc took a 75-question test. He took it at a rate of five questions per hour. Today, he took another 100-question test at the same rate. If Marc took eight hours to do the first test and six hours for the second, how many questions remained unanswered?
In a candy machine, there are 22 times as many blue gummy bears as there are four times as many pink gummy bears. If there are 12 blue gummy bears, how many roses are there?
Of the 20 rental cars available, 12 are automatic cars, 4 are manual cars and the rest are semi-automatic.
A hive has 700 bees. There are twice as many worker bees as baby bees and twice as many baby bees as queen bees. How many worker bees are there?
Jordan spends two hours a day playing video games. He also has a part-time job that pays him $10 an hour. How much money would Jordan make in a week if his playing time was spent working?
John buys $2 milk, $3 eggs, $3 light bulbs, $3 cups, and $4 cockroach traps, and considering that a 10% tax applies to all non-food items, how much did all of this cost?

Kim has started his own cleaning company and calculates the profit he can make from his clientele. He already has 3 clients, but his discussion with 5 other potential clients makes him confident enough to include them in his calculations. 2 bottles of bleach and a pack of rags will be needed to maintain each client's home. It will cost $2 per bottle of bleach and $5 per pack of rags. These are his only expenses. He calculates that his total income each week will be $92. Given the difference between total income and total expenses, in dollars, what profit will Kim make each week?
John has a 10 hectare pineapple field. Knowing that there are 100 pineapples per hectare and that John harvests them every three months, how much can he harvest in a year?

Johnny collects the toys lying around in his room. He dropped a 500-piece Lego set, another with three times as many pieces, and a final one with a quarter of the number of pieces. How many pieces does Johnny collect in total?

Debra monitors a hive to see how many bees are coming in and going out in a day. She sees 30 bees leaving the hive in the first six hours, then sees half of them coming back in the next six hours. Then, in the next six hours, she sees twice as many bees flying away as those that left the hive the first time. Then, in the next six hours, all the bees that had left and had not yet returned return to the hive. How many bees did Debra see come back to the hive in the last six hours of the day?

Brittany and her mother go to the museum. The entrance fee is $12 for adults and $10 for children. Brittany's mother gives the cashier money for one child ticket and one adult ticket. If she received a difference of $8, how much money, in dollars, did she give to the cashier?
Charlie has three times as many Facebook friends as Dorothy. Jacques has four times as many as Dorothy. If Charlie has 12 Facebook friends, how many does Jacques have?

Steve and Tim decide to see which of them will get home from school faster. Steve lives further away than Tim and therefore has the right to use his bike. Steve lives 3 miles from school and pedals at 440 feet per minute. Tim lives 2 miles from school. If Tim is traveling on a skateboard at a speed of 264 feet per minute, how long will the winner wait at home before the loser finishes the race?

Shawnda thinks that a bike inflation service would be very useful for the kids in her neighborhood. She chooses to charge by the tire. Inflation of each tire costs 25 cents. On the first day, 5 people came to inflate the two tires of each of their bikes. 3 people came to inflate all the tires of their tricycles. Finally, one person came by unicycle. How much money did she make that day?
Carl buys ten packets of cookies, each package contains six cookies, each cookie costs $0.10. How much change does Carl get if he pays with a $10 bill?

Dave bought a big packet of fries and ate fourteen of them before a hungry gull stole the packet from his hands. When the gull landed, it swallowed half the amount of fries Dave had eaten. Then three pigeons forced the gull away from the food and each of them was able to eat three fries. Later, a raccoon stole two-thirds of the remaining fries. The ants took away one last, leaving five fries. How many fries were in the packet when Dave bought it?

On Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, the student Kimo has three one-hour classes per day. On Tuesdays and Thursdays, he has two two-hour classes each day. If there are 16 weeks of school per semester, how many hours does Kimo devote to his classes during a semester?

Every day, Bill makes 300 buns, 120 chocolate croissants, and 60 sticks. The buns are 4 inches each, the croissants are 6 inches each, and the sticks are two feet each. If Bill puts all the baked goods end to end, what will their length be in feet?

To feed the monkeys in the zoo, the keeper orders bananas from a local farm every two months. If it takes 200 bananas for the macaques, 400 for the gorillas and 100 for the baboons, how many must he order to last for two months?

Blake and Kelly compete to see who can run the most in 15 minutes. They decide to do it on a 100-yard football field. Blake runs 15 laps. Kelly runs one lap, then decides she doesn't want to run alongside Blake. So she starts running the lap by limiting herself to the 40-yard line. She does it 34 times. How many yards did the winner run more than the loser?
Raphael went to the school supply store and bought four pens for $1.50 each, two notebooks for $4 each and a paperweight for $20.
Finn observes 11 tadpoles swimming in the pond. He suddenly sees 6 of them emerge from under a lily tree, then 2 hide under a rock. How many tadpoles can Finn now see in the pond?

A water tank is 17 feet deep on Monday. On Tuesday, the tank contains 7 feet more water. On Wednesday, the water tank is two-thirds as deep as it was on Tuesday. How deep is the water tank on Wednesday?

Anakin and Locsin went to the beach today. Anakin caught 10 starfish, 6 hippocampa and 3 clownfish. Locsin caught 5 starfish less than Anakin, 3 hippocampa less than Anakin and 2 clownfish more than Anakin. How many fish did they both catch?
If a bag of marbles costs $20 and the starting price goes up 20% every two months, how much will a bag of marbles cost after 36 months?

If you have several toys in a room: five red cars, three figurines and a doll, and the doll costs the same as the three figurines, and a red car costs $4, given that the figurine costs $5, what is the total value of the toys?

Jackie wonders if she should do her tax returns herself or hire an accountant. By doing it herself, she can do three hours of freelance work less, which is a $35 per hour shortfall. The accountant asks her for $90. How much extra money will she have if she hires him?

For her 30th birthday, Elvira chose as a gift a new computer with many accessories. She has a budget of 1,500 euros donated by her whole family and thinks she can save some to buy herself a dress. She goes to a computer store and chooses a device that costs 1090 euros with a screen, keyboard and mouse. She also gets a scanner for 157 euros, a CD burner for 74 euros and a printer for 102 euros. How much money will she have left for her clothes?

Sandra's neighbor gives her a basket of nine eggs every time she babysits her daughter. To make a Spanish flan, Sandra needs three eggs. If she was assigned to make 15 cream cakes for her school's fundraiser, how many times does she have to babysit?
Seth is twice as old as Brooke, so in two years, their ages will add up to 28.
Jimmy has two dollars more than Ethel has, so if Ethel has eight dollars, how much money does Jimmy have?
Except on the weekend when he walks 10 miles, Pancho walks 20 miles every day.

The band orders new uniforms. Each uniform includes a $25 hat, a jacket that's three times the price of the hat, and a pair of pants that's the average price of the hat and jacket. What is the total cost of each uniform?
Jake walks through the entomology museum, and he sees 80 eight-legged spiders, 90 six-legged insects, and three rare ten-legged mutant invertebrates. How many legs does Jake see in total?

There are four birds in the Caboose. Sally Two is three years older than Granny Red. Granny Red is twice as old as Sally Four. If Sally Four is the same age as Sally Thirtytwo, and Sally Thirtytwo is eight, what is the total age of the four birds?

Jessica wonders how much money she has to pay each month to cover all her debts. The minimum payment on her student loan is $300 a month, her credit card is $200 a month, and her mortgage is $500 a month. If Jessica wants to pay 50 percent more than the minimum, how much does she have to pay in a year?

Billy is peeling and cutting potatoes to prepare a potato salad for his big family barbecue. Since this is a big event, he has 60 potatoes to peel. The potatoes are about the same size, so it takes about the same time to peel and cut them. It takes Billy about a minute and a half to peel a potato, but only 5 seconds to cut it. How long does it take Billy to finish preparing the potatoes?

Juan and his brother Carlos sell lemonade. For every gallon they spend $3 on lemons and $2 on sugar. They get 20 glasses of lemonade and sell them for $0.50 a glass. If they made a profit of $25, how much did they spend on lemons?
In a race with 240 Asians, 80 of them were Japanese and the rest were Chinese, if the number of boys on the Chinese team was 60, how many girls were on the same team?

Zaid spends a quarter of his salary on rent, a third on fuel for his car and donates half of the remaining amount to his favorite charity. He gives $200 to his daughter for her weekly expenses and $700 to his wife for groceries and other household items. If Zaid earns $6,000 a month, how much money will he have left after all these expenses and donations?
Rani has ten more crabs than Monique, who has four fewer crabs than Bo. Knowing that Bo has 40 crabs, calculate the total number of crabs.
Lloyd makes $10 an hour tutoring maths. He taught five hours the first week and eight hours the next week. How much did he make for the first two weeks?
If the winner got three-quarters of the votes and the total number of students who voted was 80, calculate the number of votes the loser got.

Sandra, the local florist, is very unhappy with Fred's incomplete delivery. Sandra had ordered four times as many red roses as white carnations. She had also ordered 200 calla lilies roses, five times the amount of white carnations. Sandra threatened to change suppliers if the missing red roses were not delivered by 5 p.m. To keep Sandra as a customer, how many red roses does Fred have to deliver by 5 p.m.?
John is two years older than Mark. Two years ago, Mark was five years older than Jan's half the age. If Jan is 30, how old is John?

Two teams of athletes compete in a 4 x 400 meter relay, a race where each team has four members who each run 400 meters, or a standard track lap. One of the two teams is very well-rode and each of its members runs the 400 meters in exactly 55 seconds. The other team is less well-rode. Its first runner runs the 400 meters in 60 seconds, and then each following runner is 3 seconds faster than the previous one. Based on this information, in how many seconds will the fastest team win?
Jerry rolls a six-sided die, what is the probability (in percent) that he gets a number greater than 3 rather than an even number twice in a row?
Jenna and her mother picked apples from their farm. Jenna picked twice as many apples as her mother. If her mother picked 20, how many apples did they pick in total?

Russell works in a pet store and distributes straw to the rodents. The rats are divided into three cages in groups of equal size and each rat gets six pieces of straw. There are 10 hamster cages. Each of them is alone in his cage and gets five pieces of straw. There is also a rabbit pen where we distribute 20 pieces of straw. No straw is used elsewhere in the store. If 160 pieces of straw were distributed to the small rodents, how many rats are there in each cage?
Mandy owes Benedict $100, and they agreed to a 2% interest rate, so if Mandy is able to pay that amount in three months, how much does she owe Benedict?

A merchant buys a few sacks of wheat from a farmer at $20 a sack, knowing that it costs $2 to transport a sack from the farm to the warehouse, and that all the sacks were sold at $30 a sack for a total profit of $400, how many sacks did he sell?

Three friends spent $20.25 on three tickets to the fair. They also spent $4.50 less on food than they spent on the tickets. They also did two rides at $33 each. If they agreed to share the cost equally, how much did each pay?
John picks peaches for three hours. He picks two peaches a minute. How many peaches did he pick?
Ducks need to eat 3.5 pounds of insects a week to survive. How many pounds of insects does a flock of ten ducks need a day?
Tom plants 10 trees a year. He also cuts down 2 trees every year. He starts with 50 trees. After 10 years, 30% of the trees die. How many trees does he have left?

Sue lives in a neighborhood where there is a good mood. During one weekend, the neighbors decided to play a prank on her. On Friday morning, they placed 18 plastic flamingos in her garden. On Saturday morning, the neighbors took back a third of the flamingos they had painted white and placed them in Sue's garden. Then, on Sunday morning, they added another 18 plastic flamingos to the collection. By noon on Sunday, how many more plastic flamingos were there than white flamingos?
Violetta wants to buy new pencils. She needs them in five different colors and has budgeted $20 for this purchase. Knowing that a pencil costs $2, how much change will she have?
A pen costs as much as a pencil and a piece of gum put together. If a pencil costs $1.20 and a piece of gum $0.30, what will be the price of eight pens?
If you have to distribute 200 pounds of carrots to 40 restaurants in a certain city, if each restaurant is to receive two pounds of carrots, how many pounds of carrots will not be used?
In the city of Soda, there are exactly 23,786 inhabitants. 8,417 of them are men and 9,092 are women. The rest of the population is made up of children. How many children are there in Soda?

Elaine started out with 20 Pokemon cards. She collected three times as many after one month. During the second month, she collected 20 fewer cards than she collected in the first month. Finally, during the third month, she collected twice the total number of cards collected in the first two months. How many Pokemon cards does she now have?

Marc is a proofreader. He proofreads the same number of sentences each week for two different publishers, who each pay him at a different rate. Publisher B pays Marc twice as much as Publisher A. Marc edits a total of 1,000 sentences per week, while Publisher A pays him 5 cents per sentence. How much does Marc make in a week, in cents?
Baldur draws water from a well. He draws five buckets in the morning and six buckets in the afternoon. If each bucket contains five liters of water, how many liters of water does he collect each day?

John gets a prize at work. This prize consists of a one-time bonus of $5,000 and a five percent raise. If he earns $2,000 a week, every week of the year, and he got the prize on the first day of the year, how much money did he make that year?

Josie grows grapes on her ten-acre farm. She produces five tons of grapes per year on each acre, and each ton of grapes produces two barrels of wine. How many barrels of wine does her farm produce per year?

Cheese is Carl's favorite food. He ate a sandwich every day of the week at lunch and used two slices of cheese in each sandwich. He ate cheese and egg omelets for breakfast three days of the week, using one more slice per omelet than he used per sandwich. He made a large plate of macaroni and cheese to ensure several dinners that week and used eight slices of cheese in its preparation. How many slices of cheese did he use in total?

Janet had 22 green pens and 10 yellow pens. She then bought six bags of blue pens and two bags of red pens. Each bag of blue pens contained nine and each bag of red pens six. How many pens does Janet have now?

Brinley is in Mr. Bert's math class, and Mr. Bert gives six tests per semester, and he allows students to take the worst grade point average of each semester, so if Brinley got scores of 89, 71, 92, 100, and 86 on the first five tests, what score does she need on the sixth test to get an average of 93?

Michael loves to ride a bike. He does it at least five times a week and does 25 kilometers each time. He did it for four weeks, then he decided to do it only twice a week, but doing 60 kilometers each time, which he did for three weeks. How many kilometers did Michael do in total?

Joe's Halloween candy bag contains 25 chocolate bars and 80 candy apples. Each chocolate bar weighs twice as much as a candy apple. If the chocolate bar weighs 40 grams, what is the weight, in grams, of Joe's candy bag?

On Monday, Rose went to buy four cakes from one store. On Tuesday, she bought three times as many cakes from a different store. On Wednesday, she went to another store and bought five times as many cakes as she bought on Tuesday. How many cakes did she buy in total over those three days?
Twenty dozen cups cost $1,200 less than the total cost of half a dozen plates sold for $6,000 each.

Sarah wants to buy a new jacket and two pairs of shoes. The jacket she chose costs $30 and each pair of shoes costs $20. Sarah takes care of the neighbor's kids four times and earns $5 each time. Her parents give her $4 every time she mows the lawn. If Sarah already had $10 saved before she started babysitting, how many times does she have to mow the lawn before she can afford the jacket and shoes?

Jerry has a chicken farm. Red hens produce three eggs a day, and white hens produce five eggs a day. Jerry collects 42 eggs a day. If he has two more white chickens than there are red ones, how many red chickens does he have?
Gary likes to walk along the edge of the local park, which is shaped like a rectangle of 1.5 miles by 6. If he walks at 3 miles per hour, how many hours of walking does he do?

At the dollar store, Sloane counts 100 customers coming into the store, and the next day, she counts 50 more than the first day, and if the third day, the total number of customers was 500, how many customers did she count that day?

Jerry has two pools, both with leaks that drain them at a rate of four gallons per minute. Four minutes ago, the big pool had twice as much water as the small pool. Now it has four times as much. How much water is in the small pool now?
Lori wants to buy a pair of shoes for $320 and a matching belt for $32. Her part-time job pays her $8.00 an hour. How many hours will she have to work before she can make her purchases?
If she has to pay $165 a month for 12 months, how much money will Janeth have left by then?
There are four roses in the vase and seven more dahlias than there are roses. How many flowers are there in the vase altogether?
Adrian is three times older than Harriet, who is half as old as Zack, and calculate the average age of the three in three years' time, if Harriet is now 21.
Four students scored a total of 251 points in a board game. Naomi scored 68. Yuri scored 10 points more than Naomi's half, and Brianna 17 more than Naomi. How many points did Jojo score?

Carmen takes 10 minutes to finish a crossword puzzle and 5 minutes to finish a sudoku puzzle. Over the weekend, she solved 3 crossword puzzles and 8 sudoku puzzles. How much time did she spend playing these games?

A water tank holds 120 liters of water. Celine used 90 liters to water her small garden. She was then able to collect rainwater that is twice as much as what was left. How many liters of water is now in the cistern?
Andy plants 90 geraniums and 40 petunias less than the geraniums. How many flowers does he plant in total?
A company spends $15,000 on advertising one year, and then spends a third of that on advertising the next year. What is the total amount that the company spent on advertising in those two years?

Carlos and Benji are at the beach. Carlos rents a canoe for $30 an hour and Benji rents a banana boat for $18 an hour. If Carlos uses his boat for three hours and Benji uses his boat for five hours, what will the total amount of their rentals be?

Andrew plans a car trip from New Jersey to Rochester. It takes him six days to travel by bus and half that time for a car trip. How many days of travel will it take him if he plans to go to Rochester by bus and back by car?

James counts his Pokemon cards. He has 30 Fire, 20 Grass, and 40 Water. If he loses 8 Water cards and buys 14 Grass, what is the percentage chance (rounded to the nearest whole number) that a randomly chosen card is Water?

For his lunch, Chad ordered a composite burrito. The basic burrito costs $6.50, he adds an extra $2 of meat, $1.00 of cheese, $1.00 of avocado, and two sauces at $0.25 each. He chooses the premium option for an extra $3.00, which allows him to add fries and a drink. He has a $5.00 gift card that he uses at the checkout. How much is left to pay?

Kalinda is trying to make a 360-piece puzzle with her mother. She is able to place four pieces per minute. Her mother places twice as many pieces per minute. How many hours will it take them to complete this puzzle?

One watermelon farm produced 120 baby watermelons. Ashlyn went to the farm after two months and found that 30 percent of the watermelons were ready to be harvested, so she took them home. When she returned two weeks later, with three-quarters of the remaining watermelons ready, she harvested them. How many watermelons were still not ready for harvest after those two weeks?
Marc buys a fleet of 12 cars for his company. Each car sells for $20,000. He pays 10% tax on the cars, then $1,000 more for the registration of each of them. How much does he spend in total?

Kylie and Robert like to go shellfish-picking on the beach. On Monday, Kylie picks up five more shells than Robert picks up twenty. On Tuesday, Kylie picks up twice as many shells as she did on Monday. How many shells did Kylie pick up on Tuesday?
Dax went to pick apples at the farm and found twice as many insects as ants in the garden. If there were 50 ants, calculate the total number of insects in the garden.
There are 36 penguins sunbathing in the snow. A third of them dive and swim in the ocean. Another third go inside the cave to eat their dinner. How many penguins continue to sunbathe?

Steve now wants to eat more tomatoes and decides to grow his own cherry tomatoes. He eats twice as many as his girlfriend at the rate of 6 a day. Knowing that a vineyard produces 3 tomatoes a week, how many vines will he need?

John orders pizzas to share with his friends. There are 20 friends in total, and John wants to make sure that each one gets four portions. If the pizzas are only sold cut into eight portions, how many pizzas should John order?

Ram uses many pens. He discovered that he could save money by mixing the ink of five empty pens to make one full pen. If he buys 25 pens that he uses to make new pens when the ink is exhausted, how many pens will he get in total?
Johnny took his $20 allowance, and he added $10 to it, and then he invested that money, and it tripled in one year.
Mary is two years younger than Jeanne, who is five years older than Jessa. If Jessa is 20, what is the sum of the ages of the three girls?

A school building has 1,000 students. This building has 3 entrances A, B and C, which also serve as exits. If, after a meeting, 30 percent of the students leave the building through exit A, 3/5 through exit B and the rest through exit C, calculate the number of students who left the building through exit C.
Jack has six more candies than Robert. John has twice as many as Robert. If John has 54 candies, how many more candies does he have than Jack?
Dolly has two books. Pandora has only one. If Dolly and Pandora read each other's books as well as their own, how many books will they have read in total by the end?

Mike has corresponded with five people and then stopped corresponding with two of them. The others each send two five-page letters every week. He answers them the same way. If he can write a page every six minutes, how many hours does he spend writing a week?

Jason has a 1,000-minute phone plan per month. Every day, he talks to his boss for 15 minutes, and this month, he's spent an additional 300 minutes calling other people. How many minutes does Jason have left if this month has 30 days?

Griffin had 24 fries, but Kyle took five. Billy took twice as many as Kyle. Ginger gave Griffin a handful of her fries, then Colby gave Griffin three fewer fries than Kyle had. If, in the end, Griffin had 27 fries, how many fries did Ginger give Griffin?

There are 4 snails in one aquarium and 32 in another. The difference between the quantities of snails in the two aquariums is equal to twice the sum of the fish in the two aquariums. If the two aquariums contain the same number of fish, how many fish are there in each aquarium?

Jeanne's makeup artist charges her $250 an hour. She needs very expensive makeup for a movie she's in and it takes her six hours a day. She has to do it four times a week. The movie runs for five weeks. After the movie is over, the makeup artist gives Jeanne a 10% discount because of the amount of work done. How much did Jeanne pay?

Isabelle bought supplies for her little sister's birthday party. She spent $12 on the cake ingredients, $43 on the birthday gifts, $15 on the decorations, $4 on the invitations, and $22 on the goodies bags for the guests. She split the cost in three, between herself and her two parents. How much did each person pay?
A chef bought four bags of onions at 50 pounds each. If a pound of onions costs $1.50, how much did he spend?

On Monday, Sue ate four times as many cookies as her sister. On Tuesday, she ate twice as many cookies as her sister. Her sister ate five cookies on Monday and ate 13 the next day. If one cookie has 200 calories, how many more calories did her sister Sue consume?
